sentences.en: a dark valley overshadowed by towering peaks
sentences.cn: 被高耸的山峰遮蔽的幽暗山谷

sentences.en: Contemporary capitalism is a system in which the negative elements now overshadow the positive.
sentences.cn: 在当代资本主义系统中,消极因素湮没了进步因素.

sentences.en: Economic political things overshadow even common sense occasionally.
sentences.cn: 经济政治上的东西有时候会让常识退避三舍.

sentences.en: Fears for the president's safety could overshadow his peace-making mission.
sentences.cn: 对总统安全的担心会给他的和平促进任务蒙上阴影。

sentences.en: Fears for the President's safety could overshadow his peace-making mission.
sentences.cn: 对总统安全的担忧可能会给他的调解使命蒙上阴影。

sentences.en: Her new book will overshadow all her earlier ones.
sentences.cn: 她的新书将会使她以前写的书都黯然失色.

sentences.en: Hester is overshadowed by her younger and more attractive sister.
sentences.cn: 她那更年轻而且更有魅力的妹妹使赫斯特黯然失色。

sentences.en: Large oak trees overshadow the garden.
sentences.cn: 高大的栎树把花园遮得很暗.

sentences.en: The current AIDS pandemic tends to overshadow the continuing threat of other sexually transmitted infections.
sentences.cn: 当前爱滋病的广泛流行有一种遮蔽其他性传播疾病感染持续威胁的趋势.

sentences.en: There is a cloud on the horizon that may overshadow the talks.
sentences.cn: 隐隐透出的阴云可能为会谈投下阴影.

words.tran_cn: 使失色；使阴暗；遮阴；夺去…的光彩

trans.tran_cn: 使蒙上阴影； 使黯然失色
trans.tran_en: If an unpleasant event or feeling overshadows something, it makes it less happy or enjoyable

trans.tran_cn: 使失色，使阴暗，夺去…的光辉，遮阴
trans.tran_en: If an unpleasant event or feeling overshadows something, it makes it less happy or enjoyable
